steps.title: Patent upper airway
steps.content: <strong> Call for airway expert help Look, listen & feel <strong> at the mouth and tracheostomy Use <strong> waveform capnography <strong> if available

steps.title: Patent upper airway
steps.content:
Call Resuscitation Team

CPR if no pulse/signs of life

steps.title: Patent upper airway
steps.content: Apply high flow oxygen to BOTH the face and the tracheostomy

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.content: Remove speaking valve or cap (if present) Remove inner tube Some inner tubes need re-inserting to connect to breathing circuits

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.question: Can you pass a suction catheter?

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.content: The tracheostomy tube is patent Perform tracheal suction Consider partial obstruction Ventilate if not breathing Continue ABCDE assessment

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.content: Deflate the cuff (if present) Look, listen & feel at the mouth and tracheostomy

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.question: Is the patient stable or improving?

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.content: Tracheostomy tube partially obstructed or displaced Senior review and plan Continue ABCDE

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.content: <strong>REMOVE THE TRACHEOSTOMY TUBE Look, listen & feel at the mouth and tracheostomy<strong>

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.content: Re-apply oxygen Continue ABCDE

steps.title: Assess tracheostomy patency
steps.content:
Call Resuscitation Team

CPR if no pulse/signs of life

steps.title: Primary emergency oxygenation
steps.content:
Standard ORAL airway manoeuvres

Cover the stoma (swabs/hand). Use:

  • Tracheostomy STOMA ventilation
  • Paediatric face-mask
  • Supraglottic Airway

steps.title: Secondary emergency oxygenation
steps.content:
Attempt ORAL intubation
Prepare for difficult intubation

Uncut tube, advanced beyond stoma

Attempt intubation of STOMA

6.0mm tracheostomy or tracheal tube

Consider: Bronchoscope / Aintree catheter

Bougie / Airway Exchange Catheter
Call for airway expert help Look, listen & feel at the mouth and laryngectomy stoma Laryngectomy patients have no airflow via the mouth Use waveform capnography if available

Apply high flow oxygen to laryngectomy stoma

If any doubt whether a patient has a laryngectomy, apply oxygen to face also Laryngectomy patients have an end stoma and cannot be oxygenated via the mouth or nose. Applying oxygen to the face and stoma is the default emergency action for all patients with a tracheostomy
Call Resuscitation Team<p/><strong>CPR if no pulse/signs of life<strong>

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.content:
Most laryngectomy stomas will NOT have a tube in situ

Remove stoma cover (if present)

Remove inner tube (if persent)

Some inner tubes need re-inserting to connect to breathing circuits. Do not remove a tracheoesophageal puncture (TEP) prosthesis

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.question: Can you pass a suction catheter?

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.content: The laryngectomy stoma is patent Perform tracheal suction Consider partial obstruction Ventilate via stoma if not breathing Continue ABCDE

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.content: Deflate the cuff (if present) Look, listen & feel at the laryngectomy stoma or tube

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.question: Is the patient stable or improving?

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.content: Senior review and plan Continue ABCDE

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.content:
REMOVE THE TUBE FROM THE LARYNGECTOMY STOMA if present

Look, listen & feel at the laryngectomy stoma.

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.content: Re-apply oxygen Continue ABCDE

steps.title: Assess laryngectomy stoma patency
steps.content: Call Resuscitation Team<p/><strong>CPR if no pulse/signs of life

steps.title: Primary emergency oxygenation
steps.content:
Laryngectomy stoma ventilation:

  • Paediatric face-mask
  • Supraglottic Airway

steps.title: Secondary emergency oxygenation
steps.content:
Attempt intubation of laryngectomy stoma

6.0mm tracheostomy or tracheal tube Consider: Bronchoscope / Aintree catheter Bougie / Airway Exchange Catheter
